title: Beings of Love - soongtypeprincess - Good Omens - Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/3
Fandom: Good Omens - Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett, Good Omens (TV)
Rating: Explicit
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Relationships: Aziraphale/Crowley (Good Omens)
Characters: Aziraphale (Good Omens), Crowley (Good Omens)
Additional Tags: Angst, Angst with a Happy Ending, Emotional Hurt, Oral Sex, Anal Sex, Suspicions, First Time, Snogging, Emotional Hurt/Comfort, Pre-Almost Apocalypse (Good Omens)
Summary:

“A sudden cold swept over him, and he looked under the sheet. Their naked bodies confirmed his fears.”

A mistake the night before causes a rift between lifelong companions.

Oh, boy…I don’t think ya’ll are ready. I wasn’t and I wrote the bloody thing. 

This fic will be 3 chapters, so I’ll get the next one up as soon. Enjoy the hurt.

blog.name: crowleys-bentley
blog.title: To The World. ✨
blog.description:
• I will never shut up about Good Omens. •

|| Gabz, 21, angsty filmmaker. ||

~

Likes, comments, & follows from my main: @angstystoryteller

summary: Highlights and what I learned from the advanced screening last night (spoiler-free):
body:
Highlights and what I learned from the advanced screening last night (spoiler-free):

  • I can confirm that GO is the limited series of the year.
  • The casting, acting, direction, cinematography, VFX, and writing are flawless.
  • The MUSIC is just too good.
  • David and Michael really did THAT.
  • Their screen chemistry is undeniable.
  • The atmosphere and space of Hell is absolutely amazing.
  • Aziraphale + food is a match made in heaven.
  • The show should always be seen on a gigantic screen with an invested audience.
  • Neilman is legitimately naturally funny when he speaks.
  • Neilman is the softest man. He talked about how books saved him and how he learned about life from them growing up.
  • He also talked about books being a safe place for people to discover themselves and learn how to traverse life.
  • He gave some advice about stories and writing and how you should sell the way a story is told, not the story itself.
  • Another interesting thing he talked about was the construction of the baby swap scene and what he learned about making it work.
  • May 31st can’t come soon enough.

tags: In which Crowley breaks into Heaven in an act of burglary
summary: Fanfic’s coming along well, and because I am far too happy with this quote, you get it too: "What are you doing sneaking around...
body:
Fanfic’s coming along well, and because I am far too happy with this quote, you get it too:

“What are you doing sneaking around in Heaven, Crowley?… How did you even get in here?” Aziraphale hissed with growing despair. “You are a demon!”

“And the Patron Saint of Manchester, thank you very much.”

summary: I had a dream I went to my English neighbor's house and she was watching Good Omens. I asked her how she was able to watch it...
body: I had a dream I went to my English neighbor’s house and she was watching Good Omens. I asked her how she was able to watch it and she just shushed me and pointed at the television. On the screen, it was the scene with the sword and the tire iron near the end, and after all the “nice knowing you” stuff, Crowley and Aziraphale kissed. I was fairly surprised. She said it was some kind of special director’s cut that she was supposed to review and give feedback on, and that the kiss would not be on the version released on May 31st. I asked when the director’s cut would be released and she said it would be locked in a vault in Neil Gaiman’s home, only to be released at the time of his death. Then I sighed so exasperatedly I woke myself up.

summary: The Crowley Company is a world leader in archival preservation and digitization products and services. It is the only...
body:
The Crowley Company is a world leader in archival preservation and digitization products and services. It is the only manufacturer/distributor/end-user in the industry, meaning that the firm engineers scanners, distributes them and also uses them in their own service bureau. This allows the firm to uniquely understand and respond to the needs and challenges of those tasked with digitally preserving library collections and serving the digital needs of patrons. From microfilm to microfiche, newspapers to index cards, bound books to loose papers and slides to glass plates and image hosting, The Crowley Company partners with libraries of all sizes and budgets to help preserve their records and cultural heritage assets for generations to come.

[contact-form] Crowley Company The Crowley Company is a world leader in archival preservation and digitization products and services. It is the only manufacturer/distributor/end-user in the industry, meaning that the firm engineers scanners, distributes them and also uses them in their own service bureau.

blog.name: niche-pastiche
blog.title: Puns and Things of Beauty
blog.description:
I like puns.

My favorite historical depictions of Armageddon are the ones with Jesus sitting on a rainbow.

My fandoms are:

    Good Omens (book and tv), German musicals, Reptiles, History, Art, Art History, Critical Role (Vox Machina), Caitlin Doughty and The Order of the Good Death.

Most of my fanvids are for Hannibal but I have one for Captain America: The Winter Soldier.

I am, for all intents and purposes, mostly a Good Omens blog now.

summary: So i’ve been looking forward to Good Omens for so long but now I find myself bracing for disappointment because I’ve had the...
body:
So i’ve been looking forward to Good Omens for so long but now I find myself bracing for disappointment because I’ve had the fandom equivalent of that cliched moment from movies where the person relizes that the thing they really wanted was something they already had all along. 

And now i’m just like sitting here asking “DO WE HAVE A TAG TO DISTINGUISH THE BOOK FROM THE SERIES YET?” because if we have a way to clearly organize our fic and meta then as a fandom we stand a higher chance of being able to keep things civil and relatively easy to navigate. 

What do people think about referring to the book as the GOvulgate? It’s a nice single word tag that’s unlikely to be used for anything else. I am open to other suggestions but I thought I’d get this conversation started while there’s still time.

EDIT:
Other possibilities are GOtNaAPoANW, and distinguishing between #bookomens and #tvomens. 

EDIT 2:
I’m thinking bookomens and tvomens are our best bets.

title: A new moment
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2w1LI8F

by imladrissun

Castiel and Crowley start to have a new type of acquaintance with each other. They’re both interested in the idea of it.

Words: 2445, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Supernatural
  • Rating: Mature

She/her; They/Them, 34, Whatever, german, potentially kind, hates fake-feminism, Author, Astonishing and high-functioning farrago of balderdash

I do art commissions: COMMISSION INFO

NOTE: If you follow me, drop me an ask answering the following question: What's your favorite superpower?

So I know you are real. Otherwise I will block you.

tags: and oh boy do the ingame voices fit
summary: I might have started a Good Omens based game of Etrian Odyssey 5 to bridge the wait for the show. That was either the best or...
caption:
I might have started a Good Omens based game of Etrian Odyssey 5 to bridge the wait for the show.

That was either the best or the worst idea I had this month…

(Aziraphale’s name is one letter too long, so it had to be shortened)

(I am not responsible for Hastur not wearing a shirt. It’s the game’s class portraits. I just adjusted the colors)

blog.name: deppressed-blue-jay
blog.title: Deppresed-Blue-Jay
blog.description: I’d take a bullet for Misha Collins

summary:
Dean: So. Who broke it. I'm not mad, I just wanna know
Cas: I did. I broke it-
Dean: No, you didn't. Gabe?
Gabe: Don't look at...
body:
Dean: So. Who broke it. I’m not mad, I just wanna know

Cas: I did. I broke it-

Dean: No, you didn’t. Gabe?

Gabe: Don’t look at me, look at Kevin

Kevin: What? I didn’t break it!

Gabe: Huh, that’s weird, how do you know it’s broken?

Kevin: Because it’s sitting right in front of us and it’s broken.

Gabe: Suspicious

Kevin: No, it’s not!

Charlie: Dean, If it matters, probably not, Crowley was the last one to use it

Crowley: Liar! I don’t even drink that crap!

Charlie: Oh really? Then what were you doing by the coffee cart earlier?

Crowley: I use the wooden stirrers to push back my cuticles. Everyone knows that CHARLIE

Cas: Alright, lets not fight. I broke it, let me pay for it Dean

Dean: No. Who broke it

Kevin: Dean

Everyone:

Kevin: Sam’s been awfully quiet

Sam: oh really!?

Kevin: yEAH REALLY!

Everyone except Dean: *arguing*

//////

Dean: I broke it. It burned my hand so I punched it. I predict ten minutes from now, they’ll be at each other’s throats with warpaint on their faces and a pig head on a stick. Good. It was getting a little chummy around here
